posts.text:
I believe in Fairy tales, on fairies, on magic on monsters………………….

I am naive you may think, not accepting reality. I think so too! how dare I believe on something totally spun out of imagination. They for sure are children stories and I am an adult,  wouldn’t it be ridiculous if a twenty yr old told you they still believe in Santa despite knowing the truth since he was 3 yrs old.

Somewhat like this  stupid adult I close my eyes every night thinking, trying all the while hoping a little *real fairy would “today” show up in my dream. She will fulfill all my wishes for like a Genie she wouldn’t have a limited quota of three.

I know I sound so stupid the same thought crosses my mind over and over just like a big bold flashing WARNING sign.

Sometimes I forcefully stop myself from thinking about fairies but that moment of thoughtlessness lasts for only a few seconds. It is said if you stop yourself from thinking for a moment, more thoughts rush in. True!

I don’t know when I fall asleep and five minutes later my alarm rings, open my eyes and BEHOLD! It’s already morning (I’ve never experienced another instance where or when 7 hours fly by so quickly. Sadly no fairy dream not even a glimpse nevertheless I am a dreamer and “dreamers are not quitters”.

My belief my dreams also extend to daylight, dreams don’t require eyes to be closed.

Any task I do particularly the hard stuffs  like the competitive exam I am appearing for but have  done almost no studying for, sometimes the easy stuffs too like hammering a nail and impossible wishes like changing the color of my eyes; I wish (more of  think) by the turn of her magic wand all things would be done! I wouldn’t even have to get up

My dream is so pretty I sometimes wonder why even bother to return to reality  …….maybe they are a fairy’s dream who knows but there’s 1 thing I know for sure “I believe in fairy tales, on fairies, on magic, on monsters……………”

Everything living has feelings; it does not stop being an emotion just because we humans fail to understand or feel them.

                                                                                     - srijana

photo credit; http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs19/i/2007/243/3/8/Hurt_by_fantasmica.jpg

Every cloud has a silver lining but mine is only dark, frightening binding me in its deep vacuum holding me by chain of words. Often I wonder, have I committed some unknown but a horrific crime that even now after so many years I have to pay in the currency of tears by reliving it every moment of every day for it seems just like today. All thanks to the strange society, our society; it’s always hungry always sad the good in some people do exists but the bad of the society always overpowers them. I think it takes immense pleasure in killing slowly and painfully the people who are different than them. Otherwise how am I to answer why doesn’t it applause my achievements not tell me how useless they are or take pleasure in my smiles rather than forcing me drop tears or make me believe I am loved, wanted rather than telling me whole existence is a waste.

Exactly how many years have passed, I don’t know for me it’s just an arbitrary question of time but if you insist I’ll tell you today. Today I drowned my parents in loan so large they or I have no idea how it will be paid off or how many life I have to slog to be free. Because Today I experimented with weed, today I fell from the balcony to the ground 13 stories below, today I broke my bones in 27 different places and had some nasty cuts on my face. Also Today is the day when my bones have healed; a miracle they say but it left me with a very distinguishing mark  a – wobble also today the scars on my face have healed again but it will require a lengthy stretch of time to completely merge with my color.

To speak honestly a look at me and you’ll never forget my horrifying marks my wobble is what you see and forever remember. I guess you hear it too.

I have tried to live happily in my own world away from the World of pain, wretchedness, sorrow, criticism anything Worldly actually. But no matter how beautiful dreams and fantasies are you have to wake up and the World beckons me time and again and each time I fall for the trap only to drown in tears again.

* The above story is an imagined scenario.

“God like our parents can just guide us. However he also has the power to put obstacles in our path to test the strength he has endowed equally on all of us, his children. Sometimes we take the easy detour to reach the end of our path fast other times we take the less chosen option but much-loved option of the long tiring almost impossible road and sometimes while travelling we surprisingly reach our destination. That great power helps us along the way but only when we first help our self. Honestly! it’s the only rule; the golden rule he has set.”

 

Someone once told me during my period of sadness. I love and live by the very thought of an ordinary day.

 

sunrise (Photo credit: Sean MacEntee)

Every morning the newspaper comes and seldom, now it seems like never will there be a day when heart melting stories of rape victims or stories of rape victims do not appear.If it’s not the newspaper it TV,internet or word of mouth It’s all so terrible, horrible that sometimes it all seems so near to fiction but it’s “true” reality is stranger than fiction just much more ruthless and even kids are not spared. Often we are left to wonder, why sadly our quest for answer ends in the question itself.

I had never prior to now ever ‘seen’ or talked to a rape victim this was my first encounter sadly a little girl of 8 years old a totally chance meeting if I may say so. I had lots of doubts, questions and fear I can’t exactly describe it all seems such a futile effort of mind at present.

The first time I met her after so many hours of avoidance was when she barged into my office space and before I could become aware of my un-surety she just took it all away. “Pretty sister” she exclaimed holding my hand after that moment she just wouldn’t leave my side until the evening when she had to go to her parental home for court hearing, she kept telling everyone around that she will come back after the court hearing to stay here with us because she simply loves it here.

She entertained all in the office by her song by her impromptu song and dance routine interrupted by her sudden peals of laughter and questions, why is this box (computer) black? How can you call when your phone has no numbers? First we were patient in giving our ‘made-up’ answers but, what ,where,how and why were so many we ultimately had to no option but to order her in a strict voice , to sit in a corner with finger on her lips. Our strict avatar was not real enough maybe she kept up her funny antics filling every nook and corner of our office with laughter.

She sat right next to me sometimes combing my hair with her little fingers or telling me not to drink too much coffee and at times giving me wisdom filled advice. My colleagues asked her why she liked me and not them; she answered “she is so white”. Yes I am a little fair but others were too to this counter argument she just kept mum. Time and sorrow had taught her to detect fear I think.

4 hours she stayed with us and left, leaving us to normalcy. For a day we touched, felt; saw the truth and the truth was “pretty” not scary.

I cannot tell of the pain she bore physical mental but I can tell one fact it was, is and always be many times of her age.

“Birds, rivers, and breeze no borders have ever stopped them. Borders are just for humans; say what have you and I got by being humans” it’s a rough translation of a song from a Hindi movie. It depicts (not exactly) what I and many inhabitants of the Generous Mother Earth have felt every time the question of nationality crops up. I am from Nepal (yes, the small green )

If thought deeply “borders” are just rough lines, the real division is Culture. There are many countries, large and small. No matter the size, there are a number of cultures thriving within a country nonetheless there is always a point of meeting. That very point develops to become the culture of the country. So what is an easy, laidback and absolutely normal situation for a certain person may be ghastly annoying for another, the same stands true for all situations.

The difference growing up in a certain culture puts in us is nurtured by the society.  Due to many technological advancement the world has become closer, we have begun to adopt and learn aspects of different culture yet the fact is as true as ever the world is divided and so are we.

Here’s are some examples;

Home Internet connection is a luxury provided under the following conditions:

I.            You are rich

II.            You have convinced your parents you need it for education purpose but that’s a lie or is actually true

III.            You pay your own bills

IV.            You need it to help you in earning your living

V.            Your parents way are too understanding

VI.            Etc……  (I lie in the fifth reason)

In my culture Fluency in English is a sign of good education an added benefit, an (VERY) important vehicle for upward social mobility. (So forgive my English)

So to write a post;

  •       Think (it’s tough cause it has /you want it to be in English)
  •       Write a rough draft on a notebook
  •       Write down the semi-final draft (an added step for me because the first draft isn’t unified or clear)
  •       Finally then type the post

The more I think the more points I find but am just too lazy to write it down ,just imagine my work  phew…w.

Rain… by ~spider13bug

                                                                                                                                                                         

The smell of the wet mud, everything clean, beautiful green trees and the streets full of brollies of different sizes and colours – this season is simply spellbinding. People may despise this season but I belong to the opposite group.

      As there is a reason for everything-from dusting a clean table to reading old newspapers – I have cooked up an inexplicable reason to back up my liking. When the tiny drops hit the earth, memories of yesteryears come flooding back. During my school days the thing I liked most ­­_ apart from bonfire and my parents’ visit to school –was rain. It was not until the 10th standard I had the freedom to get wet.

     The season had its share of disadvantages too, but even the slimy leeches did not deter us pals from frolicking in the playground. Even during the drizzle we hit the road, our school building a clean 15 minutes  hike, making our way between the pine trees along the sides of the road.

    The trickle would take its own sweet time to subside. Meanwhile, we pranced around as if the road was our private property with no teachers in sight to stop us from sleeping on the road or performing rain dance.

    By the time we reached our destination, we would be thoroughly wet. It’s not that we couldn’t afford an umbrella or run but the feeling when the drops touch bare flesh surpasses heavenly bliss. One needs to feel the spirit of the season. The thought of our teachers taking us to task wouldn’t matter much as long as the drops rejuvenated the parched earth. During my study in Delhi, the rainy season never seemed to end. Back then we had to think twice before venturing out. Even if we summoned enough courage to do so, we were allowed out only under the watchful eye of the local guardians.

     An edition of chicken soup states that life is a chain of rainy days as rain helps shape up our lives. The most hated season is like sugar that makes food tastier, even while it’s not as important as other ingredients like oil and salt.

    I don’t mean to entice people into running out into the rain. But seasons are like different flavours provided by the grace of Almighty to spice up our lives. As tastes differ, so do the seasons.

 

September 2006

this Piece was my first article to be published in “The Himalayan Times” after  many disheartening rejections and as it is  and it will always be  a pure joy to see my name in print :)

We were the oppressed and they were the oppressors but neither we knew nor did they. We lived in the same house in a corner maybe however it was the same shelter we and they called home, we also had the same food as they, the food that we prepared though we ate without exception after they were satisfied yet they will go to extremes to not accept that, “they were the oppressors and we the oppressed”. This had been going on for generations unknowingly or in full visual. Some voices raised were quieted some just quit and a few brought about some major but small changes.

They were the oppressors and we were the oppressed, we gave them the power….

You owe me no pity neither have I ever felt the need for any; please stop looking at me like that your gaze pierce and bleeds me, it hurts so badly.

Thinking and I know i can’t  say or explain anything to you, you that can understand but don’t want to; you that are the society of which I am a part too.

I understand you are sad to see me in such a sorry state but are you “sad”. Isn’t it acceptable anymore for a person to fall sick, to fail, to be afraid; being vulnerable is what a human is I am a human seems you are untouchable by sad part of reality; make me question are you human.

You start your sympathy speech every time telling me but pretend I am deaf for a moment and direct all you have to say to my guardians.  You speak of how hard my life will be now, its ok you speak the truth but quit telling me my survival my fight is useless if you can’t make my faith stronger my belief in hope please don’t make me believe in darkness.

One stumble in life, an ill turn of fate was all you required to see me in a new light through a biased glass. You took all my achievements striped me of all the respect and love I had earned, put me naked on a podium for display. sometimes i think you waited for all this patiently.

I cringe with pain the steps I force myself to walk I fall, fail yet I walk.

It’s said everything in life happens for a reason. I’ve seen none till now, wonder what will I see but I know none even you won’t speak of me with pity but celebrate my life and I won’t let anything come in my way

ZAGREB: What becomes of a garden gnome hurled in fury at a car during a stormy breakup? Or a ted dy bear that was once a Valentine’s Day present? A wedding dress from a marriage gone awry? An axe that smashed through household furniture?
All are on display at the Museum of Broken Relationships in the Croatian capital, each with written testimonies telling tales of passion, romance and heartbreak. On Valentine’s Day, the museum sees its visits almost double.

“The objects that are here represent all the stages of a breakup… and how people go through love,“ said Drazen Grubisic, a designer and artist who co-founded the museum in 2010. “We might say it’s a love museum, just upside down,“ he said.

 

The mementos -collected from all over the world -are random and varied, ranging from fake rubber breasts to a cast from a broken leg. Each item comes with dates and locations of the relationships, and notes by their anonymous donors.

 

Some are funny. The note next to a garter belt says, “I never put them on. The relationship might have lasted longer if I had.“

 

Some are bitter. The garden gnome flew over a car driven by a husband who turned “arrogant and heartless.“ It bounced on the asphalt, shattering its face.

 

“It was a long loop, drawing an arc of time… that defined the end of love,“ the note from Slovenia said.

 

An axe from Berlin was used by a woman to smash every piece of furniture her girlfriend had left behind. “The more the room filled with chopped furniture, (the more) I felt better.“

 

The text by a blue frisbee reads, “Darling, should you ever get the ridiculous idea to walk into a cultural institution like a museum for the first time in your life, you’ll remember me.“

 

The museum, located just across from Zagreb’s City Hall where couples get married, currently displays some 100 “relics“ out of about 1,000 that have been collected from around the world. Parts of the collection have travelled as far as Manila, London and Singapore to be put on display. In each city, the heartbroken can donate their stuff to the Zagreb museum.

 

A prosthetic leg currently showcased in England at the National Centre for Craft and Design, was donated by a war veteran who fell in love with his physical therapist. A note says it lasted longer than the relationship because it was made of “sturdier material.“

 

The museum itself is the brainchild of a breakup. When Grubisic and co-founder Olinka Vistica, a filmmaker, split up, they got stuck when it came to dividing their sentimental memorabilia. They didn’t want to just get rid of it, so they created a museum.

 

“Maybe sometime in your life you will want to remember some of the good parts of the relationship,“ Grubisic said.

He said that donors of mementos find the giving therapeutic. “They can move on,“ he said. “They also show there’s something universal: We all have been brokenhearted at least once.“ -AP

Lying is wrong in any form, it’s a moral rule we’ve all been taught- a part of moral ethics of the world an underlying force of every religion, of humanity.

“Lie” saying false things to lead a person astray.

It’s said when a lie has a backing good reason is OK (how smart of you) whereas the same lie when spoken for evil situation/ wrong reason is incorrect (how could you!).

How do we know this differentiation because I /all of us were told so by our elders or the heart thinks of a reason to determine “our” lie as FOR THE GOOD

I have met a lot of people who say I don’t lie but none actually don’t.

I too lie, do you? If yes, then for what.

In this world of today where technology enslaves us ‘power cut’ runs all plan haywire so did mine. An early forced dinner proved fruitless as ‘power cut’ turned my personal computer into a useless box of filth my hope to download “anti-virus set up” crashed. On no occasion has optimism with ‘power cut’ worked more over optimism requires patience and patience has never been my virtue, expecting the alarm to do the work of waking me early next morning in order to turn my plans into reality; my only option and choice was to hit the bed and so I did. Though soft sheets covered me sleep was miles away and eventually when dreams took over, I constantly woke to check the ticktock of watch, it just showed signs of long night ahead but if I knew what tomorrow held for me,  would the night not be so long…

Chirp and twitter of birds though consisting of only coo’s and caw’s woke me so sweetly to a wonderful day wishing a loud good morning and releasing me from the awful drone of my alarm. All the joy in world can not ever stand up to the twinkle in these eyes which arose on hearing those voices and sound which were long-lost.

I remember a time not so long ago all sounds even a mere clip clop of the occasionally passing horse aroused curiosity with imagination taking over, taking this lonely soul for a long beautiful ride, with a promise of a friend for life. Hell arose when what I wished and prayed earnestly for-just a license to do all I desired ‘adulthood’ came true but being busy with other things and imagination dead,  my friend was lost, the one who knew every bow- bow, every meow like every sound of beep carries a message to us only the ‘messages are long forgotten’(Why did I crave adulthood). Years later I met her again thanks to the simple sounds of life, she the child inside me swore to never ever leave me so alone again, if only if I let the child inside me smile always. :)

The sound of a little ha-ha or a sight of toys is enough to let it free

Originally posted on George. Jessie. Love.:

About a year after I had finished my run-in with breast cancer, Tony Snow (the former White House press secretary) returned to television for the first time since having been diagnosed with colon cancer.  It was a school/work morning and Rich and I were trying to get ourselves and the kids up and out the door.  “The Today Show” was on and we were half listening to the interviewer when he asked Tony for reflections on what he had been through.  He responded by saying that it was “the best year of his life.”  Rich looked at me and asked me if I knew what he meant.  Indeed, I did.

Whether it is cancer, or a death or a divorce or a little boy announcing that he is really a girl, difficult life experiences have this crazy ability to turn logic on its ear and prove to be wonderful times…

By night tears flow screams of the heart pierce the black curtain. The same question is asked a million times, no answer comes from the other end.

Soul blurts out lines of anger points of bargain but again no answer comes

Soul asks again and again in whispers; the heart bleeds from the sharp noise. What ill did the soul that such a punishment was netted out for the body?

Rational mind explains in every possible way “it’s all a plan, it will unravel soon” but every attempt fails –ah the folly. The heart continues to bleed tears flow for the same reason, with the same question.

Late hours of the night moments of sleep is caught on a wet pillow, soon light send the dark to rest – a new day or a continuity of cruelties.

Body and soul leave the room, body puts on a smile

Fake, brave……

“War” the greatest manmade destructive force. Hundreds lay dead, thousands wounded, loud sounds of wailing fill the air urging with the horrific sight of the remnant the world to mourn; millions worth of property destroyed but the dead-alive grieve with tears passing by the hot cheeks not for the lost money but for the happy moments and memories   created under the sheltered roof, of the days spent cradled in the safe womb called “home”. The ongoing and after-effects of war are long and depressing even to mention but are they enough to be the face of the country?

A country, each uniquely crafted by the almighty filled by his likeliness and creatures of his wondrous creation. Hasn’t the terrain more to offer or the maker failed to chisel it to perfection? Landscapes so beautiful that any human eyes would crave, caves any explorer would die for, potteries which tell stories dating thousand years back, a dream of any archeologist. Yes! This and much more has the every land to offer (if you let your heart ‘squander’).

Each country apart from the remains of war has some beautiful sites to boasts, any eyes would lust for of but all becomes null and void once field of landmines or decades of war, are mentioned.

But are they enough to be the face of the country?

Two years ago we, our family adopted a street dog. It was already six months old then and against my parents’ wishes- it was a female. I wouldn’t call her smart (she would bark at even us only a change of clothes required) but she was very friendly, for some reason she would lie and offer her belly to be patted  and wouldn’t move nor let us go until we did so maybe she thought it made us happy or her belly was very pretty. She didn’t have the least bit of manners, coming to places forbidden kitchen especially nor did she know any tricks and if there was such a competition she would definitely come first at disobeying commands. In-spite it all we fell in love with her. That’s just my Julie

…its feeling like a long-lost friends met once again, going together on an old route of laughter once again.

Yes, that’s exactly how I felt when I read the Archie’s comics after a gap of umm 8-9 yrs …though the laughter was and always has been there.

I was in class1 when I was first introduced to it that was of course “Little Archie” it had all the little characters; as the name suggests. So there was little Betty, little Veronica, little Jughead; little Reggie but of course Mr Weatherbee was the same old bald man a.k.a principle and little Archie always somehow managed to get into trouble.

With time I graduated to reading the Archie “version”. I love it so much maybe because it provided me an image of a ‘cool’ school, and fun times I never had; I don’t know the reason for sure. So here’s a Salute to my fairyland and as the years pass by may I never call it stupid.

I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul. (Photo credit: Aristocrats-hat)

Out of the night that covers me,
Black as the Pit from pole to pole,
I thank whatever gods may be
For my unconquerable soul.

In the fell clutch of circumstance
I have not winced nor cried aloud.
Under the bludgeonings of chance
My head is bloody, but unbowed.

Beyond this place of wrath and tears
Looms but the Horror of the shade,
And yet the menace of the years
Finds, and shall find, me unafraid.

It matters not how strait the gate,
How charged with punishments the scroll.
I am the master of my fate:
I am the captain of my soul.

William Ernest Henley

No matter how hard he tries, his eyes moisten. He is told a million times it’s not manly to cry yet the hurt he went through have a powerful effect even now. Those days of hurt, pain, loneliness, depression and every sad emotion humans have ever felt.

This life, the need for assistance in each step was actually his life; he often wondered. He lived and mourned it, day after day nevertheless his land; the land of his dreams showed no glimpse of reality maybe that’s way they are called dreams. He was not born this way perhaps that’s one reason why reality was so hard to accept.

The voice of society hunted and followed him encouraging words were few; all he heard was lines discouragement and regret masked in the package of sympathy. He often wondered which part of society did he belong to whether he did belong or not… he desperately wanted to belong but even then “not” would be a better answer.

He my friends, has devised ways to console himself, he keeps repeating “he gives me only what I can endure for the Lord knows my strength”.

Some years ago, me, some of my batch mates and our tuition teacher along with her family went for a day’s trip to Darjeeling. It was our rejuvenating break before the Boards and also supposed to be a day of shopping gifts for our friends at school. That was a tradition of our school.

DowHill School

About money, now that was our short coming we were just students living in a hostel; pocket-money was a few hundred over a thousand.

There were three categories of gifts we each had to buy;

  1. Special for our friends
  2. Something cute and little for the juniors who were close to us
  3. Something signifying best of luck or I remember  you for all(25) batch mates

Shopping was done and we all were fairly satisfied but time remained before we were to begin our return journey.

So we decided to do a little walking around if not for buying at least for seeing pretty things plus the “heavy”   food we just had; had to be digested.

It was then I saw these inspiring words on a poster, which I immediately bought WITHOUT EVEN BARGAINING.

Footsteps in the sand
 
 
One night a man had a dream.
He dreamed he was walking along the beach with the LORD.
Across the sky flashed scenes from his life.
For each scene, he noticed two sets of footprints in the sand:
one belonging to him, and the other to the LORD.When the last scene of his life flashed before him
he looked back, at the footprints in the sand.
He noticed that many times along the path of his life
there was only one set of footprints.
He also noticed that it happened at the very lowest and saddest times of his life.This really bothered him and he questioned the LORD about it:
“LORD, you said that once I decided to follow you,
you’d walk with me all the way.
But I have noticed that during the most troublesome times in my life
there is only one set of footprints.
I don’t understand why when I needed you most you would leave me.”

The LORD replied:
“My son, My precious child, I love you and I would never leave you,
During your times of trial and suffering,
when you see only one set of footprints, it was then that I carried you.”

Author unknown

There is a hospital in Vellore CMC, which has some very good words circulating about it so that’s why we my parents and I went to Vellore,  South India and the reason was me. After many visit at CMC when all reports said- no need to worry. We decided to go to Tirumala which is just a few hours ride from Vellore and is an important Hindu pilgrimage, here is the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple which is dedicated to  Lord Vishnu and the residing deity is lord Balaji. We being Hindu it was no big decision.

Like every religion Hinduism also has developed some very distinct characteristics, which sometimes appear strange; even to people of the same religion. The feeling was of great surprise when we saw people in groups numbering in hundreds with hair cut rendering them bald what was even  more surprising  was the presence of females among them in great numbers.  We knew many devotees have their head tonsured as an offer to the Lord but women…  Now the thought of bald women would be considered outrageous in our society religious though we are “Hindus” so my mother and I dint agree to it if that was the only reason I won’t say yes.

But the people who did so did it for faith and some (like these)do it for a good reason… :)

books (Photo credit: Wikipedia)

I love books on any subject of any kind novels, short stories, essay, etc (my condition: books be well written and interesting).

Only downside is my town does not have a well stacked library plus I am dependent on my parents at the moment. The books I own are less than a dozen in number they all have been read so many times until every single word has been totally relished. Yet the device I spend at least 2 hours a day doesn’t have any book down-loaded (it’s not a crime, I wonder).

Labelled as so many things; friend, treasure, loyal, etc books are also an ideal companion to kill time (which at the moment I have plenty).

Like all things they are based on an idea from the writer’s mind, it has the power to take anyone on a journey around the world in 80 minutes r 18 hours; depends on individual speed to read process and comprehend words; all without leaving the comfort of our home. Precisely for this very reason I fell in love with the eloquently expressed ideas found on paper (but there are so many other reasons to, like little branches of a big tree).

There was a time when computers were rare and internet access even rarer but advancement in technology has made the unreachable easily reachable and affordable. So now it’s just a matter of few clicks and lo! The book you want is down-loaded, ready to be read; legal or illegal is “not” the question.

Like many of us I was at a very young age when I was first introduced to the magical world of books and I fell deeply in love never to recover. The sweet fragrance of places yet to discover and meeting new people all within a few pages really excited me and the hidden “greediness” that it would help me with my English. Holding the book in my hand, reading from the pages as I move quickly towards the end gives me unexplainable pleasure; such happiness that no matter how much I try I am never able to put it in right words.

Call me what-you-please the thought or idea to read books on any digital device simply puzzle’s me always, it’s so hard to accept the “new” avatar(e Books )of my Dear Friend Books.

who doesn’t  want  to be appreciated and loved?

I  just don’t have the words to express my happiness,

Every room had a fan, ceiling fan this room had a white one now an uninteresting mix of black, grey and brown years of use, spilled oil, cobwebs and dust had accumulated to give it such a colour. When the harsh summer sunrays entered the grey room through the small window, it made the dust particles in its path gleam for an instance it looked like a finger-pointing towards the fan.

It wasn’t the only thing in the room but it was the only thing in his mind; as he lay on the bed helpless.

Off late a lot had happened crushing his dreams, blocking his ambitions changing his course of life forever.

One mistake and the price was so heavy.

He had always heard car and alcohol are a dangerous mix now he lay there alone as a proof; with a leg crushed, in plaster.

Burnt by the fire of ego, he thought self-respect is “now” the only thing he owned, he didn’t want to lose it; being dependent on his family for the smallest of things was unacceptable to him. Enough shouted his stoned soul.

The family, they were out at work at the moment, this was the perfect time. With a determination and desire to end his life taking over his mind and heart.

He tried getting up to reach “salvation”, the fan that hung only a few feet above the bed; he couldn’t his body refused every command it received. He struggled violently against the invisible shackles he tried many times he did everything with the remaining strength that he couldn’t but nothing moved him towards the fan.

He just laid there, hot tears streaming down his face, tears that spoke volumes; tears that he didn’t care to wipe.

THE RAVEN

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary,

Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,

While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,

As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.

`’Tis some visitor,’ I muttered, `tapping at my chamber door -

Only this, and nothing more.’

Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December,

And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.

Eagerly I wished the morrow; – vainly I had sought to borrow

From my books surcease of sorrow – sorrow for the lost Lenore -

For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels named Lenore -

Nameless here for evermore.

And the silken sad uncertain rustling of each purple curtain

Thrilled me – filled me with fantastic terrors never felt before;

So that now, to still the beating of my heart, I stood repeating

`’Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door -

Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door; -

This it is, and nothing more,’

Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,

`Sir,’ said I, `or Madam, truly your forgiveness I implore;

But the fact is I was napping, and so gently you came rapping,

And so faintly you came tapping, tapping at my chamber door,

That I scarce was sure I heard you’ – here I opened wide the door; -

Darkness there, and nothing more.

EDGAR ALLEN POE

Dark clouds took over the clear blue sky, with every passing second it became darker.

But the attention grabbing factor were the winds that began to sweep up the dust that lay everywhere in cracks on walls, in between leaves of trees, among the flower petals, on in accessible  tin roofs, on  paved roads; invading every little space available.

Looked like God had switched on a huge vacuum cleaner.

In couple of hours the Rain began.

Huge drops in a very slow fashion touched the lips of the parched earth. If the rain were human you’d probably hear laugh and see her smile and if the earth had arms you’d see him raise his arms to get closer to his beloved.

However wait was not yet over.

She the Rain did not give in easily; all she did was tease the earth leaving him wanting for more.

The sky remained black, wind replaced Rain and the cleaning continued.

It was already night when the Rain started again now accompanied by very frequent flashes of lightning and sounds of thunder; which kept many mortals humans tossing and turning in bed all night.

When the morning came rain was quenching the thrust of earth,

it was still raining but slowly and gracefully she came to a complete halt.

The Sun peeked from in between the clouds that had at the moment vanished.

Everything looked new “clean” as if overnight the earth had shifted to a new planet.

 
That’s how the first Rain of the season graced us, it brought  about a lot of wonderful changes but I get unaccountable pleasure  whenever I see The only plant in my garden that bore white flower which now looks a lot “fresh” white-er and the trees surrounding my house looks greener.

Flowers at the rain ( , Dusheti Dist) (Photo credit: Wikipedia)

 
 
 
 
The sweet smell when the first few drops of water touched the dry soil was beautifully en-gripping something no words describing it would ever do justice only experiencing it will. I’ve always waited for it each year of my being; it always without fail manages to instil in me the numerous good reasons of being alive.

life

A man can be destroyed but not defeated.- Ernest Hemingway

The same dream plays over and over, as if it’s the only tape compatible with the player of the brain.

 

In darkness and in light it repeats itself often with small changes but the outcome always a satisfying smile, a positive energy fills the air and begins an eager wait for the future of rainbows.

 

Then amidst the smile unknowingly eyes moistens tears begin to flow tear of sadness, tears of uncertainty.

 

The question voice itself; was the dream a sign, a signal of fate, a peek into the future or just an image of unaccepted Reality …

“You can do it I know, you are my brave daughter”.

 

She always believed in her father’s words he was a pious soul and in some ways God always answered his earnest prayers, silent prayers. When he spoke now it felt like the Lord spoke for his daughter in distress.

 

It is said in the Holy Bagwat Gita “do your deeds in full truthfulness, don’t hope for result”.  The daughter wanted the result; the father wanted her to do just as it said.

 

She tried numerous times but each time failure was the face she saw. Very frequently the thought to give-up crossed her mind, it worth her full effort but she wasn’t hopeful things would ever change.

 

Her father thought otherwise.

The world talked of her as a useless case but some people are made so different, they drink all the tears and hurt and bring forth a genuine smile of surety.

 

She tried many times sometimes drawn by false promises other times by hope or with a very disturbed outlook towards life. Her heart filled with anger for whom she knew not but she’d spit all her venom on her father; her only friend in need.

 

A sane mind would ask what was his fault, what was he responsible for however that was just who she was not at the moment.

 

Like a good father he forgave the words and forgot the pain they caused.

 

Days crawled to become weeks months years and her hopes raised and fell many times, but she still hears her father say with full belief frequently, every single day;

“You can do it I know, you are my brave daughter”.

Every-time I try to write, anything essay, article, story, even my journal and now this blog; it’s usually fine in the beginning 1 to 5 sentences (tops 10) then as always I get stuck. No words I think seem to convey my thoughts, but the moment I put my pen and paper away my mind automatically conjures up some many really good lines. If I put an effort to pen it which turns out to be in vain cause I somehow magically forgotten the words  , no matter if I had repeated it to myself a millionth …ok Truly  hundred times to myself.

Bedtime’s no different, the moment I wish everyone good night, slip under my quilt and close my eyes same thing happens. My incomplete article(in realty) get completed with some just too good lines, I get hold of some wonderful story plots  which is the reason I often wake up in the middle of the night and promise myself I will remember it. Alas the same forgetfulness haunts the next morning. L

I guess this isn’t ‘only my problem, many suffer from this disease [literally]. Which makes me wonder and fantasize about “the Great, Mighty, Wonder PEN”. Just think a device which writes all your thoughts down.  Think about the possibilities.

For me it would be a blessing. In only a day I would be able to produce giant “voluminous” Book, though the ideas may not be coherent at all because in a single day my thoughts fluctuate many times from one extreme to the other.

I will no longer have to verbally participate in any quarrel {I say this in the nicest possible way} the Pen will write down all my mean thoughts.

I could go on and on for I seen numerous possibilities, now I’ve said it you too must be thinking…umm any voluntaries for making it?

Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things

not seen.

Not all but many of us have crossed the threshold to adulthood hearing or reading stories, it’s a totally different avenue to talk about if we are a still a child trapped in an adult’s body.

The stories we heard, some were with a moral some were just entertaining in their own way however each has helped shape who we are today.

 

As the spirit of sharing takes over me I present a story I heard years ago, in the words I write today (I may not be able to do it full justice but I tried)

A long time ago there lived a monkey on a tree by the river and the river was home to a lonely crocodile.

 One day   the monkey got hold of some grapes. He sat on the tree to peacefully enjoy them, as he was eating a few pieces fell in the river. The crocodile saw them he must have been very tired of non-veg foods for he tried them. The grapes were a pleasant change for his pallet; he never had eaten anything so sweet and tasty.

 He asked the monkey for more grapes and the monkey generously dropped a bunch in the river and a new story of friendship began.

 

The monkey bought fruits ripe and sweet and without fail dropped some for the crocodile in the river and in turn the crocodile promised to protect him forever but nothing ever was verbal for in friendship many things require no agreement it is simply understood.

So in this spirit things continued for a long time.

One afternoon as the crocodile lay basking in the sun, an evil thought entered his mind “the monkey eats such sweet fruits his heart must be very sweet”.

. (Photo credit: Wikipedia)

With the intention to kill the monkey and eat his heart the crocodile lured his friend on crossing the river on his back and he did succeed in his intentions but his friend’s heart wasn’t sweet.

He was cursed with loneliness again.

THE END

 

 That is it, a simple story that left a lasting impression.

 

 N b; your friends might be by your side or miles apart but they are only a few numbers away; show your appreciation show them you care; though years may have passed by.

Do you believe in life after “life” REBIRTH?  A life that was once yours, a life you remember nothing of now, filled with relations and relatives if talked about at present would all seem like a mythological tale.

It is said that in heaven God has an assistant specifically to write down all the deeds of all individuals dividing them in two categories “the good and the bad” depending on which God decides one’s destiny of next birth.

But what is BAD hurting a human being a person filled with emotions and feelings  just like yourself or hurting any being (without being sure if it actually did hurt but the intention was to hurt).

What are the criteria for harm emotional, physical or both? And what count is the deciding factor?

We are all God’s children, does god believe in reward and punishment form of teaching. Why will God punish us so ruthlessly, will he have the heart to? I know my parents won’t not because they can’t but because they love me.

Studying the holy  scriptures minutely may provide all the answers but I don’t feel the need to for I believe this is the only life I’ve had and will be my only visit to earth with the relatives and relations God choose for me. The hard ship and hurt I have faced any harm I caused (in future too) were just “supposed” obstacles’ in my path to form a better me, to be able to utilise the gifts given by God.

(Photo credit: the|G|™)

 But do you believe in rebirths, why?

The one beauty of poetry is rather than painting a full picture with words and telling a tale it lets the Reader imagine. There is always room to add and subtract for the reins no longer remain in the hands of the Poet.

It becomes more than a beautiful combination of words or a story the poet intends to tell but with each reader it takes a different form, it tells a new story; story said not just by the words but by the emotion of the unwritten words which just suggests their presence.

Maybe that’s why Poetry never grows old; it only begins to tell a new story.

 

ON HIS BLINDNESS

When I consider how my light is spent

Ere half my days in this dark world and wide,

And that one talent which is death to hide

Lodg’d with me useless, though my soul more bent

To serve therewith my Maker, and present

My true account, lest he returning chide,

“Doth God exact day-labour, light denied?”

I fondly ask. But Patience, to prevent

That murmur, soon replies: “God doth not need

Either man’s work or his own gifts: who best

Bear his mild yoke, they serve him best. His state

Is kingly; thousands at his bidding speed

And post o’er land and ocean without rest:

They also serve who only stand and wait.”


On His Blindness is one of the best known sonnets of John Milton. It may have been written as early as 1652, although most scholars believe it was composed sometime between June and October 1655.

The Road Not Taken

Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both
And be one traveler, long I stood
And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth;

Then took the other, as just as fair,
And having perhaps the better claim
Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
Though as for that the passing there
Had worn them really about the same,

And both that morning equally lay
In leaves no step had trodden black.
Oh, I kept the first for another day!
Yet knowing how way leads on to way,
I doubted if I should ever come back.

I shall be telling this with a sigh
Somewhere ages and ages hence
Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—
I took the one less traveled by,
And that has made all the difference.

“The Road Not Taken” is a poem by Robert Frost, published in 1916

Both these Poems have told me my story, different one countless times.

 Which Poem tells yours?

Death is Strange, knowing your loved one is dying is Stranger.

 It’s always hard trying to come in terms with it, once a person is born Death is decided but still each Death is difficult even if its 100th   we’ve encountered.

 We ask with questions beginning or with sentences ending with why. We often weep in despair, silently: sometimes offering ourselves as replacement because a life without them is unimaginable. All with a heart raging in the fire of questions; later the same heart tries to console.

 And soon… it might have taken years but no matter how long it’s always too soon for Death to come.

Again tears flow but not silently lamenting the tragedy sometimes screaming but the Dead cannot hear can they?

A few days, months, years slip by and still the memories of the Dead follow everywhere. Willingly or not, the place the Dead formally had in our life, is or will be taken by someone else not wholly maybe, a part; yes.

The Dead is still missed we smile laugh, cry for no reason and visit memory lane countless times. However the truth prevails “once a person is born Death is decided”.

Some years ago I fell ill, seriously ill and it had given no sign of its coming proving the saying “disease follows symptoms” false. It was in those days my dreams crumbled and ambitions had their last  breath, for days of sickness had stretched into months and months to years.

I became depressed. Irritability and irrational mood swings were all that my day consisted. I felt pity for myself; the feeling gripped me so hard I began to believe no one in the whole wide world was more miserable than me. There was not a single night when I didn’t cry myself to sleep.

In the earlier days I got phone call from my friends worrying about my health and of hope about how things would be all right. This made me very happy to know they worried about me so much, they cared. As the days of illness stretched their calls had more than just their worry, it had news about them of their educational pursuits, a fact which was always in my mind but was physically not possible I felt cheated for I was always more ambitious than them and it irked me a lot. The thought that I was no long the centre of their universe was very hurtful. Their every Good news was a day full of sadness for me and often the same “Ghost of happiness” haunted me for days. When we became Friends like millions of others around the globe we took a promise, the unwritten unsaid promise that “come what may: sickness, health, joy sorrow success, failure riches or poverty; we’ll be there if not physically emotionally”. So what happened now, scores of questions raced across my mind tears flew freely.

Time is always the best teacher and so I learned, when they made a sacred promise I took it too, a promise that “I’ll always be for them”. I was so very selfish to think about me all the time  my life, my grief, my illness instead of keeping my part of the promise and being happy in their happiness for  every kind of relation is a two-way road when u get u got to give back .

Now I know just as I am living my life with my joys and sorrow they have theirs to live. So I now truly promise “I’ll be there for you always”

My teacher once slapped me for calling her names; the ‘incident’ forever became immortalized under the name “Witch Matter” that’s one of my worst memory but often the first when I walk the lane of memories.

The incident happened just when “class-9”was half way through and we were fully immersed in the power game, after all we were only a few months away from being the senior most in the girl school and immediately a lot of positions would be vacant like school captain, prefects, etc exclusively for us to fill so for first time we awaited eagerly for the next term. In all it was not a “right” time for anything bad to happen to any of us or was it?

One fine day during summer when the sun didn’t shine with all its might and rain decided to meet the parched earth I heard my name being called as we all gathered for the assembly, strange is all I thought for its always after we sing a few hymns all announcements are made and I was “dying to go out”, that day Miss.Chetteri* my nepali teacher, our vice-principle was on day duty. Others were called too nevertheless it was highly unusual to be summoned before the assembly began but orders are meant to be followed so we went. She stood on podium raised high for all to see and gave a speech which was more of a slur of insult guided at us.
As if standing there wasn’t enough with our heads hung low for a crime we didn’t know imagining hoping praying the juniors won’t see us, this wouldn’t affect our results, our future “here” or the posts we were vying for; she made us stand on the podium clearing the view for everyone. Then for the first time she let us and the rest present there know “our crime” in intelligible words Witch, yes that’s what we and the rest of the school called her but we were the only fools to get caught and now were a big part of a “live” show for the rest as to why refrain from the use of the word Witch for her. She was adamant it seems to prove what a Witch she could be inflecting pain not only with her hands but with words as well, words which this environment didn’t allow so we had a good enough reason to walk out the moment she shouted “get out”.
I am no scholar in Nepali but have always managed to avoid the dreaded red mark with a precious few grace marks however this time with the Witch matter passing Nepali seemed a distant dream depressingly she was also my house(red) warden so goes down the drain my dreams of becoming the vice-captain.

This is all my mind replays again and again every-time I think of my old school, the humiliation, the pain of that cruel summer day but that’s not all what happened. Result day came and a gust of relief swept over me as I heard my Nepali marks, I had passed not with flying colours but passed as I always did. The next term came with more good news I became the vice-captain Miss.Chetteri* our red house warden had used her deciding vote on my favour.

This brought in broad daylight the power of human forgiveness but now when I think of it’s just the wretchedness felt that day standing there as words of insults came hurling at us; it’s difficult to think over happy thoughts in moments of sadness just to help provide a little positive lift and it works too well no pain has to be taken to prove it scientifically. It’s difficult I know but is it impossible.

People seem alone reserved always fiddling with their cell-phone but in reality  they are very open and social, always with people they are friends with.

Oh!I tried real hard with full effort but no matter how much I tried to run  away it followed/stalked me springing up in news, songs, movies everything I was  listened  to or had interest in had mention of “it” and strangely even in conversations between friends and doubly strangely even among enemies.

It was time to take control in  my hands so deciding enough of it all I began (after much-much thought) my month of trial after all how much harm could it do, if I don’t like it I can just deactivate it right?

 I am a student living in a  country where the hours of load-shedding is about to beat the hours of the day this fact influencing my available hour of internet surfing , which is as you have guessed is “not long” and a sword of uncertainty  hangs over it always.

 Keeping the available ‘options’ in mind I created face book account, added some friends and promptly let know my hate of social networking sites publicly.

Since then and now many things have changed, I hate to admit “my dislike is not strong anymore ”in fact I enjoy it ,I like being there though not all my friends are here  but even the handful are plenty for now. Facebook is a place “only” for the friends of mine who are friends with me in real life who are sadly separated by various reasons education, career, etc (with 3 or 4 exceptions).  It has brought me in contact with people I thought I wouldn’t be lucky to meet again and it has brought me to their notice.

From the time I remember the “big-ol-red tree” was always there, where the gate to my house should have been but those were nicer times of bamboo fences so no place for metal gate. We still don’t have a metal gate but that’s a totally different story.

The little eyes of the childhood me just saw the blooming red flowers of the tree hence the name. The flowers bloomed all year-long; more in my presence I always assumed. I never knew the actual name of the tree and neither did I try to find out

I studied in a boarding school from the very beginning. When I came home for a holiday back home, the first thing I did was hide behind the “big-ol-red tree” and send my father to tell my mummy I hadn’t come home though she would always eventually find me I always  have and will believe it did baffle her a little bit at least.

This was the only activity I ever did share with the “big-ol-red tree”.

It just stood guard maybe fencing my family from all evil.

Every time I had a visit home I noticed it had changed no! it didn’t grow bigger or taller just that majestic redness had increased I imagine that’s why it looked new.

Once during my winter holiday a conversation among the adults stirred up the tree’s branch would eventually touch the electricity wire propped up on the poles very near it; which I now know is very dangerous but back then it was just some adult hocus-pocus.

It was decided it should be cut. Cutting said one will help induce the tree to grow more beautifully and for which I haven’t been able to forgive that neighbor even after years of his death I don’t think it ever made a difference to his family however.

The next day was decided to cut it.

The day dawned and unlike other days I didn’t go out to play; did anyone notice I think not. I just closed myself in a room from where I could hear the commotion but not see the “big-ol-red tree” hurt. Every thud on it trunk was silenced by the raised volume of the TV; Tom and Jerry was never so uninteresting.

Mummy called out to me it was evening already though I avoided seeing it curiosity got better hold of me, I looked there stood just inches of the trunk and some branches instead of my “big-ol-red tree” which never grew to show us it full majesty again.

The next time I came home a barren land greeted and the game of hide and seek just stopped.

My Dearest,

      Every second of these three years stretched to a day where every morning began with your thoughts and night invited me with your dream. You just have no idea how much I miss you!! My arms miss holding you.  My eyes miss your smile.  My ears miss the sound of your laugh.  I miss the smell of your hair and the taste of your lips.  I miss your head resting on my chest.  I miss snuggling close to you.  I miss brushing back your hair, exposing your neck to loving and tender kisses.  I miss holding your face in my hand and staring into your beautiful eyes.  I miss being held by you.  I miss being near you.  I miss you.

    Before I forget the real cause for writing this letter I had a dream last night, I dreamed of us; holding hands we were walking along the beach the moon rays were reflected by the sand and they shone just like diamonds and such was the night it made you look so gorgeous as never before  it was all so beautiful to be just a dream then suddenly someone called my name and foolish me I jerked off your hand and ran away my dearest am I going to die ha ha ha!

        Dreams aside life is treating me fine here and would have kept me happy too if my love was here. I know my fair lady you love and miss me too; you are surely waiting for “our” big day of togetherness. You know  I came here with an unwilling heart as sometimes head rules the heart for good for when we are hungry love will not feed us or in cold clothe us we need money for that and if this path leads to earning a world of happiness for you and me so be it.

    Yes! Sweetheart I do stand guilty on your grounds and I utter not a word to the accusation you place for I know they are all true. From the day we tied knots till date what have I given you, all but failed promises, remember the three successive Teej when I couldn’t make the journey to home you sent me tear stained letters to remind me that you were sad when you should have been accessorized with a huge smile for yet again I failed to keep my word. Though all your letters are such but they hold a special place among all and I don’t know why. My promises hold no place in the kingdom of truth you say but my being in body will prove I speak the truth, this Teej and every day that follows will be different when I’ll be there to obey all your commands no matter how silly they are, other than ever being apart from you.

          Sugar you look better than fairies of a child dreams with ornaments on though you’ve none now, you pawned all to help me for my journey to Saudi Arabia but I’ll make up Trust me? You’ll have more than your dreams and girls will go green with envy when the see you and scores of boys will follow you though the ever known truth will remain “you are mine”.

           I’ll be your shield to protect you from hurling words, a prop when you want one, a reservoir of soothing balm when my parents’ word and actions hurt you I’ll be there always. I know my sweet one I do know they don’t treat you right. They blame you for the unhappiness prevalent in the family please, please forgive them.

         I’ll be home within the month, surely I will inform of the day. Dear you know I love u a lot take care of your self I wouldn’t bear to see you sick or hurt. When you are hurt I’ll know even if you don’t tell me how? cause my dreams inform me.

 I love you.

Your,

Rajesh.

         Sheela wiped her tears tore the letter to pieces, gave a last check in the mirror came out of her house where she and Rajesh had seen many dreams, none ever came true. Now she was to bid farewell to the house, uncountable dreams and Rajesh; no she could never tear away from him. Happiness though short lived had stained her life with memories.

          He did come back as promised; the only time he kept his words. But he was no longer a reservoir of soothing balm, just a cause to weep over, to feel hurt and betrayed. He came yes; he did DEAD as promised in body.  Rajesh’s family her family was happy today to at last get rid of her after she had taken the life their dearest and only son though for her it was tough job to hold back tears.  

        As she took small heavy steps to a different world, the place she had given willing to Rajesh years ago, today was to be occupied by Dilram; the man who few years ago and even today was seen by her pretty eyes as a devil with her pawned ornaments, now and here she was to be his wife.

The wind whispered sweetly into my ear, as if to remind me of the drunken lull of darkness. Hark! I did. I always do. Give in to the nature. Find it incomprehensible that most people do not take some time out for themselves. For there is nothing like gazing up at the boundless sky, engulfed by a star-studded blanket; when the moon lets down her veil revealing the beauty that make any girl turn green with envy.

At these times, I cannot help feel that I am the sole creature of the universe and the entire world is manifest just for my eyes; only for my eyes. Were it not for the scrapping and scratching next door, it would have been more blissful. Ah, I gather. Not everybody can marvel nature’s thousand gifts.

Suddenly, I am seized by the smell of freshly baked bread wafting up into the air, from, who knows. Having skipped dinner, my tummy growls. But who has time for such trivialities? I only start to contemplate again… an owl whizzes over my head. Headed home I reckon. Who knows one more avatar of the Almighty?

The contemplative silence, it’s essence in emptiness, beauty in not being yet all engulfing. And amidst this beauty the twinkling dots in the sky, inviting me to play dots and dashes. I dappled here, cross up there.

At these precious moments, I feel free from the chains of time. All shackles are broken: nothing to hold back. No bars on my thoughts. No restriction on my imagination. No limit on my ever-expanding imagination. And then … a night prowler scurries across our fort lawn. It rushes through the  leaves, its tiny feet crackling the little twigs.

Soon and slowly, the almighty sun takes a peek riding high on his seven horse chariot. The green carpet began to glitter. As if God was running his fingers through it himself. Birds of all hues and colours began to chirp, and flutter, creating, as if, a perfect symphony of Beethoven.

The perfect Mozart concerto!

In the words of Laurie lee: if ever I saw blessing in the air, I see it now…in this still early day. How true these words ring in my ears as this precious night gives way to an equally majestic day.

Daffodils
 
I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o’er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden daffodils;
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.Continuous as the stars that shine
And twinkle on the milky way,
They stretched in never-ending line
Along the margin of a bay:
Ten thousand saw I at a glance,
Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.
The waves beside them danced; but they
Out-did the sparkling waves in glee:
A poet could not but be gay,
In such a jocund company:
I gazed–and gazed–but little thought
What wealth the show to me had brought:
For oft, when on my couch I lie
In vacant or in pensive mood,
They flash upon that inward eye
Which is the bliss of solitude;
And then my heart with pleasure fills,
And dances with the daffodils.

It wasn’t in the course prescribed for us by the education board, yet with soul so deeply moved by the tough, delicate skin of words I read ‘The Daffodils’ by Wordsworth  countless times. The words of the poem appeared to me as shining brass goblets filled to the brim with sweet wine and I unquestionably drank. The feeling of the intoxicating wine flowing through my veins of emotions surpassed all human and heavenly desires. My quality of greediness surfaced with the overwhelming desire to be always drunk, my mind copied every word and kept it safely in one the many shelves of memory to be used in every nook and corner of ‘life’. In perfect harmony with nature the earth moved on its path and years rolled past; in the passage of time my ‘soul anthem’ turned into an  old ,useless file no longer used.

But time again bought me close to those words – my forgotten  friend , (my course book contains it now) as I read it, I feel and know for sure as years passed, I grew so did she ‘beautiful old Daffodil’. Forcing me to accept the saying that, “poetry never grows old” as truth, for the best craftsmanship always leaves holes and gaps… so that something that is not in it can creep, crawl or thunder in making the lines perfect for every situation ‘ joy or sorrow’ for ‘now or for years later’ .
The wise say –the problem with growing old is not how a person changes but how things change; in the run to own all things craved like a good career they lament we forget the ‘essence’ of our life. From the day we spoke our first alphabet poetry and its various forms has lived in our every nourishing drop of blood, in the flowers we see, in the bird’s flight, in the snapping of twigs, in the smell of washed clothes, in the swishing sound of the *sari  that(maybe) your dear mother wears in everything and in all senses poetry lives and yet some lines you so loved dearly one day are forgotten on another.

The beauty of poetry is that, one doesn’t have to be a poet to appreciate poetry, for poetry is that time of night, lying in bed, thinking what you really think, making ordinary things extraordinary trespassing the barriers of time, for poetry is just the utterance of imagination addressed to the heart And the human race is filled with passion of imagination regardless of age or the time passed. Yes, you have it too.

One fine day, for no reason whatsoever I decided to clean my room, this is a very rare and elaborate process. (People should know I have cleaned my room  otherwise what’s the use of cleaning so before  I clean I make sure the room is really DIRTY.)  Sorry, your guess is wrong my room is small, the smallest in the house, 12×6 :( only.

The only material things this room can boast of are; minimum pieces of furniture, a computer  now replaced in usage by laptop and  a cupboard filled with letters, cards, and address books which are now items of the past, nevertheless I promise to hold on to it forever.

Every time I begin cleaning my room, they hinder my way, taking me on an unexpected ride across time and space that makes me wonder, sigh, smile and often prompt me to ask why.

a year of collecting for a life time of memories!

There was a time not long ago when the only cheap and good means of communication was writing letters. They often involved months of wait but when it reached the addressee, it didn’t bring along just news but also companionship.

It was one of the first things I learnt in school though it was limited to copying as the teacher wrote on the blackboard; I was in a boarding school and just had begun learning the “English language”. Since then it built for itself a special place, a place of joy and sorrow, of timid love confession, of heartaches and heart breaks.

Soon in reality years the most important chapter of life was coming to an end but it was soon, always too soon. It was then I realised that when one is happy time flies; my school years had now just days to be over, friends of years were about to be separated with the hope to meet again someday and till then letters would be the refuge of friendship. (A gift of studying in a boarding school; friends separated by borders, spread across countries.)

Then, to announce the pending calamity one of our classmates received a letter, the last in her life and ours too. It was a typed letter-her sister had just learnt to use the computer and had sent the proof of her new-found skill.

Computers were then rare as was internet access, and mobile phones were to be fancied at that time in India and Nepal. However, in a matter of just two years it came as a small desire in our life and conquered us forever.

 Nowadays, news of every event, be it joy or sorrow, comes easily via the internet on the computer or the mobile phone. Letters do come, but the remembrance, love and hugs in ink never come.

Today is different from yesterday as the past and present should be. Changes have come, but the way our communication has changes has to taken for real.   A sad, sad fact to live with I just  realized it has been years since  I saw the post man on his bicycle bringing us “waited” news hidden in his blue bag.

that’s how we “dressed” our envelope
last of the kind i have with me!

You are what you think

If you think you are beaten, you are.

If you think you dare not, you don’t.

If you like to win but think you can’t,

It’s almost a cinch you won’t.

 

If you think you’ll lose, you’re lost.

For out in the world we find

Success begins with a fellow’s will

It’s all in the state of mind.

 

If you think you are outclassed, you are.

You’ve got to think high to rise.

You’ve got be sure of yourself before

You can even win the prize.

 

Life’s battles don’t always go

To the stronger or faster man.

But sooner or later, the man who wins

Is the man who thinks he can.—CW Longenecker

The above poem was printed on a newspaper “the Himalayan times” to be precise some five years back I was then suffering from an illness in the words of my father I escaped from the clutches of death that was fast closing and was on the hard journey of recovery. I read and reread the words, something un-explain-able positive happened so I cut out the poem covered it with transparent duct tape and kept it in the book I use the most “Oxford dictionary”; to  gain a little inspiration every time I search for word-meaning.


what is the story behind your healing words. :)

Off late I have been very  busy with a lot of things and the highlight is me doing my Masters from an entirely new University (oldest of the country Tribhuvan University (TU) is a public university in  Kathmandu, Nepal. Established in 1959. Quoted directly from Wikipedia. New for me and my first in a Nepal) plus the campus I’ll be attending is community owned to make things more interesting. Only five days to start, I am so so excited for the classes to begin I can’t make myself do anything except for one thing think.

The thoughts of the memories not so cherished and cherished have taken me on different rides with every individual moment.

I was little girl of 4-6 yrs then and had just changed schools. The new school was only up to STD 3 and students of this new school spoke PERFECT English for the eyes and ears of this girl, it was simply unbelievable. English was/is a foreign language taught only in private schools and spoken with a funny accent in movies.

My previous school was the only school in town that taught English (numbers and quality have both grown now)

English was limited to;

  • What is your name?

My name is Srijana Kattel.

  • What is your father’s name?

  • What is your mother’s name?

Apart from these questions and answers which I had learnt by heart I knew nothing else a simple missing or addition of word was enough to confuse and turn me totally insane with tears.

 

It was after my father left me in the boarding school, Sunshine school Kurseong India (I am from Nepal) questions of doubt surrounded me. I was  asked what’s your name( I was Dumb at what’s)a girl my age asked , if I was missing my parents another was I non-veg or vegetarian, another which dormitory was I assigned to and so on and so forth I hardly remember maybe because I started to cry or it just wasn’t an age to remember. The crowd of little boys and girls that had surrounded the “new” girl were doing an honest effort to make her feel comfortable had just managed to break the Scary dam of unfamiliar words. I doubted for a long time if parents and dormitory were actual words to be spoken in actual world.

 

Seeing me cry a sweet lady (she gave me candy) she told me she was a miss (teacher) her name was Daisy, Miss Daisy to me she asked me in a dialect I knew which apparently she did not know well so she used a lot of English words in between and a huge amount of sign language the reason of my crying for which the answer was I knew no English (she knew it already I think) followed by loud sob… sob.

 

She smiled at me and said; Beta (cultural cue-in India a son or a beta is more preferred than daughters maybe that’s why in time it became a term of endearment)  beta see all those boys and girls some day you will speak better English than all of them I know. How?

Me; nod

Miss Daisy; baccha(child) read anything you can find, talk don’t feel shy even if you are wrong, listen carefully when others talk, talk to yourself even if you find it ridiculous, think in English pray in English ,dream in English.

Well end of the memory of first day. I could cite number of lessons I have learnt from those life changing words as I state all my flaws, like maybe my grammar’s weak or I have to frequently visits the dictionary but I won’t and before I move on I thank with all my existence my first grade teacher though I don’t even remember what she taught me later, all I remember though she never told directly I think that’s what she meant;

no obstacle will ever be my war for it’s just battle in the long journey of life.

A limp body lay on a chair facing the window elbow resting on the table, her study table; a table decorated with lots of ink marks most deliberate few accidental.

The gentle breeze turned the blank pages of a notebook that lay on the table. She just sat there watching the breeze move the Pen move from the top to the bottom of the flat surface of the table, she stopped it just before it almost fell towards the floor  moving the Pen back and watch the breeze roll it again and again.

Suddenly a smile flashed on the blank face like a brilliant stoke of lightning on a starless night.

She hurriedly picked up the Pen wrote a few lines paused thought read and reread stopped before feverishly crossing and scratching up the lines all the while cursing herself.

A story that has been going on everyday of the month with little changes nothing significant.
